title: Relationship with Friends
description: Adult friendships require intention and effort to maintain. They are a vital source of support, laughter, and perspective, enriching our lives in ways that family cannot.
sentences: Quality over quantity becomes more important as you get older.
Friendship is a two-way street; you have to give support to get it.
Schedule recurring get-togethers (e.g., monthly brunch) to ensure you connect.
Be present and an active listener when you are with your friends.
Celebrate their successes and be there for them during their struggles.
dos: Reach out just to say hello, not only when you need something.
Remember important dates like their birthday.
Make an effort to befriend your friends' partners.
donts: Don't be a flaky friend who cancels plans last minute.
Don't engage in gossip or talk behind your friends' backs.
Don't make the friendship all about you.
Don't let disagreements fester; address conflicts directly and kindly.
